Node.definition: = a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= town; ◄ in Moab (מֹואָב)
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= process by which humans or objects are removed from existence, through death or total destruction
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= town, probably to be identified with Kir Hareseth (קִיר חֲרֶשֶׂת) ◄ located in Moab (מֹואָב)
= process by which humans or objects are removed from existence, through death or total destruction

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a town ◄ in Moab (מֹואָב) said to be built by the tribe of Gad (גָּד) ► but also attributed to the tribe of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן)
= place of worship, often situated in an elevated location, but not necessarily so
= action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= town; ◄ territory of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן) ► later part of Moab (מֹואָב)
= town; ◄ territory of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן) in Moab (מֹואָב)
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

= a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning
= a growth of hair on the chin and lower cheeks of a mature man’s face, ≈ the absence of which is regarded as shameful
= causative action by which humans cut off (part of) their hair
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare

Node.gloss: to gird oneself|to put on (clothes, armor)
Node.definition: = action by which someone ties a belt or piece of cloth around the waist; hence also: to put on clothes or armor
= a coarse dark material ◄ made of goat or camel hair; ► worn next to the skin as a sign of mourning or repentance
= the structure forming the upper covering of a building, usually built as a terrace, to which one goes up by stairs
= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

Node.gloss: to stream with tears|to melt in tears
Node.definition: literally: to flow in weeping; hence: = process by which tears flow in copious amounts from the eyes of humans ◄ as a result of deep sorrow
= action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

= town; ◄ territory of Gad (גָּד) ► former residence of Sihon (סִיחֹון) king of Amorites (אֱמֹרִי) (who had captured it from Moab (מֹואָב) assigned to clan of Merari (מְרָרִי) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) later occupied by Moab
= town; ◄ territory of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן)
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= town; ◄ territory of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן) ► assigned to clan of Merari (מְרָרִי) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) later occupied by Moab (מֹואָב)
= action by which humans make themselves strong and powerful by putting on armor
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
exact meaning unknown: = process by which the body trembles as a result of fear or distress
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= pertaining to a person that is on the run from danger
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= town; ◄ in the south of Jericho (יְרִחֹו) Valley; on south bank of Wadi Zered in Edomite (אֲדֹמִי) territory
= town; ◄ located in Moab (מֹואָב)
= town; ◄ located in Moab (מֹואָב) at a relatively high elevation
= action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= town; ◄ located in Moab (מֹואָב)
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

Node.gloss: to rouse|to stir up|to raise|to stoke
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes an event to start taking place, ◄ as if it had been dormant or inactive for a certain time
= body of water, ◄ located in Moab (מֹואָב)
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived

Node.gloss: to be ravaged|to be consumed|to waste away
Node.definition: literally: to be finished; hence: = process by which objects are heavily damaged to the extent that they are almost gone
= a general term for plants, ► used as food by humans and animals; ≈ associated with frailty, but also with prosperity
= green leaves ◄ of a plant or tree; ► eaten by both animals and humans; ≈ associated with weakness and mortality
literally: what remains, or is left over; hence: = possessions that one has in surplus over the possession one needs in order to live
literally: to make (possessions); hence: = action by which humans obtain possessions
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
literally: to cause to hold, carry; hence: = causative action by which humans take hold of objects and bring them to another location
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= town; ◄ located in Moab (מֹואָב)
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to their grief and distress
= location; ◄ in Moab (מֹואָב) perhaps in the north, in contrast to Eglaim (אֶגְלַיִם) in the south
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to their grief and distress
= town, ◄ located in Moab (מֹואָב)
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= town, ◄ located in Moab (מֹואָב)
= action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
